program.description: Deprecated. Please use the 'script' property instead to specify the absolute path to the PowerShell script to launch under the debugger.

script.description: Optional: Absolute path to the PowerShell script to launch under the debugger.

args.description: Command line arguments to pass to the PowerShell script.

cwd.description: Absolute path to the working directory. Default is the current workspace.

computerName.description: Optional: The computer name to which a remote session will be established.  Works only on PowerShell 4 and above.

processId.description: The process id of the PowerShell host process to attach to.  Works only on PowerShell 5 and above.

runspaceId.description: Optional: The ID of the runspace to debug in the attached process.  Defaults to 1.  Works only on PowerShell 5 and above.

powershell.useX86Host.description: If true, causes the 32-bit language service to be used on 64-bit Windows.  On 32-bit Windows this setting has no effect.  This setting does not affect the debugger which has its own architecture configuration.

powershell.enableProfileLoading.description: If true, causes user and system wide profiles (profile.ps1 and Microsoft.VSCode_profile.ps1) to be loaded into the PowerShell session.  This affects IntelliSense and interactive script execution.  The debugger is not affected by this setting.

powershell.scriptAnalysis.enable.description: Enables real-time script analysis using PowerShell Script Analyzer.

powershell.scriptAnalysis.settingsPath.description: Specifies the path to a PowerShell Script Analyzer settings file. Use either an absolute path (to override the default settings for all projects) or use a path relative to your workspace.

powershell.developer.powerShellExePath.description: Specifies the full path to a PowerShell executable.  Used to change the installation of PowerShell used for language and debugging services.

powershell.developer.powerShellExeIsWind.description: If true, indicates that the powerShellExePath points to a developer build of Windows PowerShell and should be configured appropriately.

powershell.developer.bundledModulesPath.description: Specifies the path to the folder containing modules that are bundled with the PowerShell extension (i.e. PowerShell Editor Services, PowerShell Script Analyzer, Plaster)

powershell.developer.editorServicesLogLe.description: Sets the logging verbosity level for the PowerShell Editor Services host executable.  Possible values are 'Verbose', 'Normal', 'Warning', and 'Error'

powershell.developer.editorServicesWaitF.description: Launches the language service with the /waitForDebugger flag to force it to wait for a .NET debugger to attach before proceeding.

powershell.codeFormatting.openBraceOnSam.description: Places open brace on the same line as its associated statement.

powershell.codeFormatting.newLineAfterOp.description: A new line must follow an open brace.
